original: Ellioth, Christian Folke Ferdinand, disponent, Göteborg, f. 17/4/94 i Stockholm av fabr. E. F. E. o. Olga Widgren. G. 20 m. Maggie Falk-Simon. Barn: Marianne f. 21, g. m. ing. Knut Rösholm, Falk 25. — Stud’:ex. 14, KS 16, AIHS 18, und:löjtn. v. Fortifik. 16. Chef f. Sv. Tel:byråns Gbgsfdil. 19-21, verksit. dir. fr. 21 o. styr :ordf. fr. 41 i A-B Linnefabr. Mer-kur i Gbg, styr :led. i Sv. konfektions-ind:förb., i Sv. konfektionsfabr :fören., i Sv. kravattfabr :fören. Med’1. av Ro-tarykl. Hobbies: vapensaml., segling.
translated: Ellioth, Christian Folke Ferdinand, manager, Gothenburg, b. 17/4/94 in Stockholm to factory owner E. F. E. and Olga Widgren. Married in 1920 to Maggie Falk-Simon. Children: Marianne b. 1921, married to engineer Knut Rösholm, Falk b. 1925. Education: graduation 1914, Civil Service 1916, Military College of Health 1918, second lieutenant of Fortification 1916. Head of the Swedish Telephone Agency in Gothenburg 1919-1921, executive director from 1921 and chairman of the board from 1941 of AB Linnefabr. Merkur in Gothenburg. Board member of the Swedish clothing industry association, the Swedish clothing factory association, and the Swedish tie factory association. Member of the Rotary Club. Hobbies included collecting weapons and sailing.
